result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Earl Evans Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  To commence no later than 1/26/2016.
 Huber privileges for work.

Fine of $1,000.00 inclusive of all costs including the  DNA surcharge.  Due 10/20/2016 or serve 25 days in HOC.

-Court finds the defendatn was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful payment of the fine and completion of AODA course at completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Earl Evans Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order regarding extewnding time to pay fine, received and filed. LNR
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
LETTER REQUESTING PAYMENT PLAN OF $200.00 PER MONTH, FILED

Defendant Robert Earl Evans in court with attorney Daniel C Adams.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed:  Defense sentencing memorandum.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.    Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 days
 in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 0 days served; Huber privileges for work.  Sentence to commence no later than 1/26/2016.   
Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $1000.00 inclusive of all costs including the DNA surcharges due and owing 10/20/2016 or 25 days in the HOC.
  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful payment of the fine and completion of AODA course completion at completion of the sentence..
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form, received and filed.

Defendant Robert Earl Evans in court with attorney Daniel C Adams.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT TWO: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Earl Evans in court with attorney Daniel C Adams.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for CONTINUED  pretrial conference in Branch 47  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Earl Evans in court with attorney Daniel C Adams.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Earl Evans in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  More time to obtain counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Earl Evans in court PRO SE.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant requests time to hire private counsel. Court grants defendant request. Case adjourned to branch 47 for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Earl Evans in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/30/15 @ 1:30 pm
